subject: AI
title: Handling No Results
description: What your RAG system should do when retrieval comes up empty.

hook.text: User asks a question. The retriever finds nothing relevant. Without a fallback, the LLM hallucinates an answer and presents it with full confidence.

buildup.text: Every RAG system needs a 'no results' path. Check the similarity scores of retrieved chunks â€” if the best score is below your threshold, trigger the fallback.

discovery.text: Good fallbacks: 'I don't have information about that topic,' redirect to search, suggest related topics, or escalate to a human. The worst fallback is pretending you found something.

twist.text: Setting the similarity threshold is tricky. Too high and you reject valid results. Too low and you pass irrelevant chunks. Calibrate it using your eval set, not gut instinct.

climax.text: A RAG system that says 'I don't know' when appropriate is more trustworthy than one that always has an answer. Users learn to trust the system because its answers are reliable.

punchline.text: The most honest answer is sometimes 'I don't know.' Build that path explicitly.

quiz.question: What should a RAG system do when no relevant chunks are retrieved?
options: Hallucinate an answer from training data
Trigger a fallback like 'I don't have information about that'
